intro: Struthanthus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils, often in desert or semi-desert environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Struthanthus parvifolius is adapted to arid conditions, with deep roots and a compact growth form to conserve water.
